title: Is My Installer Qualified?
description: Verify your shop meets critical safety standards

questions.text: Is the installer AGSC (Auto Glass Safety Council) certified?
questions.helpText: AGSC certification is the industry standard for windshield safety

options.text: They claim to be but I haven't verified

questions.text: Can they perform ADAS calibration in-house?
questions.helpText: In-house ADAS calibration is essential for modern vehicles

critical_failure.title: DO NOT USE This Installer
critical_failure.summary: This installer has shown dangerous ignorance or fraud indicators.
critical_failure.explanation: Based on your answers, this installer has displayed one or more critical red flags that indicate either dangerous ignorance of modern windshield safety standards or potential fraud: Critical Red Flags Detected: • ADAS dismissal: Claiming ADAS calibration is "not necessary" shows fundamental ignorance. This is MANDATORY per vehicle manufacturers and can result in safety system failure. • Unsolicited 'free windshield' offer: Classic insurance fraud scheme. These operations often perform substandard work, use inferior materials, and may commit insurance fraud in your name. • No SDAT understanding: Saying you can "drive immediately" after installation shows they don't understand adhesive curing. The windshield won't have proper structural bond and could fail in a crash. The Danger: Using this installer puts you at serious risk: • Safety systems may not function in a crash • Windshield may not provide proper roof support in rollover • Airbags may deploy incorrectly • You may unknowingly be part of insurance fraud • Substandard work could fail catastrophically What You Should Do: Find a different installer immediately. Look for AGSC certification, proper ADAS equipment, and transparent, professional practices.

highly_qualified.title: Highly Qualified Installer
highly_qualified.summary: This installer demonstrates professional qualifications and modern safety knowledge.
highly_qualified.explanation: Excellent! This installer shows all the hallmarks of a professional, safety-focused operation. They have the proper credentials, equipment, and knowledge to perform a safe, reliable windshield installation. Key Qualifications Present: • AGSC Certification: Industry-recognized safety training • ADAS Equipment: Can properly calibrate modern safety systems • Proper Facility: Climate-controlled environment for adhesive curing • Written Warranty: Stands behind their workmanship • Transparent Pricing: Complete quotes with all services included • SDAT Knowledge: Understands adhesive curing science Before Proceeding: Even with a highly qualified installer, verify these final details: • Get all warranties in writing • Confirm final price includes ADAS calibration (if applicable) • Ask to see AGSC certificate • Request pre/post-scan documentation for ADAS • Understand SDAT for current temperature conditions • Confirm OEM glass option for ADAS vehicles What to Expect: A professional installation with proper materials, techniques, and safety system verification. You should receive written documentation of warranty and calibration completion.

qualified.title: Qualified Installer
qualified.summary: This installer is competent with acceptable qualifications.
qualified.explanation: This installer demonstrates competent qualifications and should be able to perform a safe windshield installation. While they may not have every ideal qualification, they show sufficient knowledge and capability. Strengths: • Basic safety certifications or demonstrated competence • Understanding of ADAS requirements • Proper facility or equipment • Professional approach to warranty and pricing Areas to Verify: Before proceeding, address any gaps in qualifications: • If AGSC certification is claimed but not verified, ask to see certificate • If ADAS is outsourced, confirm who performs it and get documentation • If warranty is limited, understand exactly what's covered • If quote is incomplete, get itemized breakdown including all services Questions to Ask: 1. "Can I verify your AGSC certification?" 2. "Who specifically will perform the ADAS calibration and can I get documentation?" 3. "What exactly is covered under your warranty?" 4. "Can I get an itemized quote showing all charges including calibration?" 5. "What is the Safe Drive-Away Time for today's temperature?" You Should Be Comfortable: If they provide clear, professional answers to your questions, proceed with confidence. If they're evasive or dismissive, consider getting a second opinion.

caution.title: Proceed with Caution
caution.summary: This installer has some qualifications but is missing key credentials.
caution.explanation: This installer shows some basic competence but is missing several important qualifications or has raised some concerns. While they may be able to complete the work, you should proceed carefully and consider getting a second opinion. Concerns Identified: • Missing or unverified AGSC certification • Limited or unclear ADAS capability • Incomplete quotes or vague warranty information • Less-than-ideal facility or equipment • Some minor red flags in approach or knowledge Why This Matters: Windshield installation is a critical safety service. Missing qualifications can indicate: • Lack of proper training in modern safety standards • Inadequate equipment for ADAS-equipped vehicles • Potential for substandard work or materials • Higher risk of installation problems Before Making a Decision: 1. Get detailed answers to all missing information 2. Request everything in writing 3. Get a second quote from an AGSC-certified installer for comparison 4. Ask specific technical questions (SDAT, adhesive types, calibration procedures) 5. Check online reviews and complaint records Consider an Alternative: If this installer cannot clearly address your concerns or provide missing credentials, strongly consider finding an AGSC-certified professional with in-house ADAS capability.

unqualified.title: Likely Unqualified
unqualified.summary: This installer lacks essential qualifications for safe modern windshield installation.
unqualified.explanation: Based on your answers, this installer is missing multiple essential qualifications needed for safe, reliable windshield installation on modern vehicles. Using this installer creates significant safety risks. Missing Critical Qualifications: • No verified AGSC certification • Limited or no ADAS calibration capability • Inadequate facility or equipment • Poor warranty or unclear pricing • Lack of knowledge about modern safety standards The Safety Risk: Unqualified installers can: • Install windshields that fail in crashes (improper adhesive, technique, or curing) • Leave ADAS systems uncalibrated or improperly calibrated • Use inferior materials that degrade over time • Fail to achieve proper structural bonding • Create water leaks, wind noise, or optical distortion Why AGSC Certification Matters: AGSC certification ensures the installer has been trained in: • Modern adhesive chemistry and application • Proper surface preparation techniques • ADAS system requirements and calibration • Safe Drive-Away Time science • Quality control procedures • Industry best practices and safety standards Strongly Recommended: Find an AGSC-certified installer with in-house ADAS calibration equipment. The peace of mind and safety assurance are worth any price difference.

do_not_use.title: DO NOT USE This Installer
do_not_use.summary: This installer has a negative qualification score indicating serious problems.
do_not_use.explanation: This installer's negative score indicates they have multiple serious red flags that outweigh any positive qualifications. This suggests either dangerous ignorance of safety standards or potentially fraudulent practices. Serious Problems Detected: • Multiple red flags or warning signs • Negative score from critical deficiencies • Potential fraud indicators • Dangerous lack of safety knowledge • Unprofessional or concerning practices Common Problems with Low-Scoring Installers: • Use of cheapest materials regardless of quality • Ignoring manufacturer requirements for ADAS • Improper adhesive application or curing • Mobile service in inappropriate conditions • Insurance fraud schemes • High-pressure or deceptive sales tactics • Dismissive of legitimate safety concerns The Risk is Not Worth It: Even if the price seems attractive, the safety risks and potential for: • Failed windshield in crash • Malfunctioning ADAS systems • Insurance fraud complications • Substandard work requiring re-installation • Water leaks and structural problems ...far outweigh any cost savings. Find a Qualified Professional: Search for AGSC-certified installers in your area. Verify their certification, confirm ADAS capability, and get everything in writing. Your safety is worth the extra effort.
